summary: This is a civil complaint filed in the Southern District of New York by an anonymous plaintiff (Jane Doe) against the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate and Ghislaine Maxwell. The plaintiff alleges she was sexually trafficked and abused by Epstein and Maxwell beginning at age 16 in 1995/1996. The document details the structure of the alleged sex trafficking enterprise, the 2008 plea deal, Epstein's 2019 arrest and death, and specific allegations of abuse in New York and New Mexico. This is a civil complaint filed by a plaintiff (referred to as 'Jane Doe' or 'Plaintiff') against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, alleging sexual assault, battery, false imprisonment, and intentional infliction of emotional distress. The document details specific incidents of abuse at Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico and Les Wexner's estate in Ohio, as well as threats from Maxwell and the plaintiff's unsuccessful attempts to report the crimes to authorities and the media.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The central defendant, described as a billionaire who operated a transcontinental sex trafficking network, recruiting and abusing minor girls. He is deceased, and his estate is being sued.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Allegedly participated in the sexual assault and false imprisonment of the plaintiff. Called the plaintiff to threaten her and destroy her art career to keep her quiet.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Defendant sued in his capacity as an appointed executor of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Defendant sued in his capacity as an appointed executor of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein.

persons.name: Kenneth Marra
persons.context: U.S. District Judge who made findings in a related case (Doe 1 v. United States) regarding Epstein's sexual abuse of more than 30 minor girls.

persons.name: Richard Berman
persons.context: U.S. District Judge who formally dismissed the SDNY indictment against Epstein after his death.

persons.name: Martel Colon Miro
persons.context: One of the witnesses to Jeffrey Epstein's last will and testament, executed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Gulnora Tali
persons.context: One of the witnesses to Jeffrey Epstein's last will and testament, executed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Amber Sutherland
persons.context: New York Post reporter who interviewed Epstein in 2011, quoted in the complaint.

persons.name: James B. Stewart
persons.context: New York Times reporter who interviewed Epstein in 2018, quoted in the complaint.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Allegedly sexually assaulted and falsely imprisoned the plaintiff at his Zorro Ranch in New Mexico and at Les Wexner's Ohio estate. Described as having great power, wealth, and connections.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Owned the Ohio estate where Epstein had a guest house. The plaintiff was assaulted there, and Wexner's security personnel allegedly prevented her from leaving.

persons.name: Joshua I. Schiller
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP who signed the complaint on behalf of the plaintiff.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP listed on the complaint.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP listed on the complaint, with pro hac vice status pending.

connections.description: Maxwell is alleged to have spent years overseeing and managing Epstein's sex trafficking network, recruiting girls, and conspiring with him to maintain the operation.
Indyke is an executor of Epstein's estate, appointed in his will to administer his assets.
Kahn is an executor of Epstein's estate, appointed in his will to administer his assets.
Maxwell is accused of recruiting the plaintiff under false pretenses, pressuring her to massage Epstein, and sexually assaulting her at Zorro Ranch.
Epstein is accused of grooming, trafficking, and sexually abusing the plaintiff beginning when she was 16 years old.
Allegedly worked together to recruit, entice, assault, and imprison the plaintiff. Maxwell made threats on Epstein's behalf.
Epstein owned a guest house on Wexner's Ohio estate, where an assault allegedly took place.
Maxwell was present with Epstein at Wexner's estate where an assault occurred; Wexner's security was involved.
Both are attorneys from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP representing the plaintiff in this complaint.

events.title: Start of Sex Trafficking Enterprise
events.description: The complaint alleges Epstein's sex trafficking ring started at least as early as 1995.

events.title: Abuse of Plaintiff at Zorro Ranch
events.description: The plaintiff, then 16, was flown to Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico under false pretenses, where she was allegedly sexually assaulted by Maxwell and groomed by Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Plea Deal
events.description: Epstein pleaded guilty to a single Florida state charge of procuring a minor for prostitution and entered into a non-prosecution agreement (NPA) with the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest by SDNY
events.description: Epstein was arrested pursuant to a sealed indictment from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York charging him with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Dismissal of Criminal Indictment
events.description: U.S. District Judge Richard Berman formally dismissed the SDNY indictment against Epstein following his death.

events.title: Assault at Zorro Ranch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly sexually assaulted and falsely imprisoned the 16-year-old plaintiff at Epstein's remote Zorro Ranch in New Mexico.

events.title: Assault at Wexner's Ohio Estate
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell allegedly sexually assaulted the plaintiff at billionaire Les Wexner's Ohio estate, where Epstein owned a guest house. Wexner's security personnel prevented her from leaving.

events.title: Maxwell's Threatening Call
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell called the plaintiff on behalf of Epstein and threatened to burn all her art and destroy her career to silence her about the assault.

events.title: Report to NYPD and FBI
events.description: The plaintiff reported the assault to the NYPD's Sixth Precinct, which referred her to the FBI. The authorities allegedly ignored her reporting efforts.

events.title: Termination of Criminal Action Against Epstein
events.description: A criminal action against Jeffrey Epstein related to the same sex trafficking enterprise was terminated, which is cited to support the timeliness of this civil complaint.

events.title: Filing of Civil Complaint
events.description: This civil complaint for battery, false imprisonment, and intentional infliction of emotional distress was filed against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York 10021 (Epstein's mansion)
49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico 87056 (Epstein's ranch)
U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's domicile and location of his estate probate)
Palm Beach, Florida (location of prior abuse mentioned)
Paris, France (mentioned as one of Epstein's residences)
Great St. James Island (Epstein's private island)
keyFacts: The plaintiff alleges she was sexually trafficked and abused by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell beginning at age 16 in 1995/1996.

The complaint describes a detailed scheme where Maxwell would recruit young girls under false pretenses (e.g., modeling for Victoria's Secret) for Epstein's sexual gratification and that of his associates.
Specific abusive incidents are alleged to have occurred at Epstein's New York townhouse and his remote Zorro Ranch in New Mexico.
The document references Judge Kenneth Marra's finding that Epstein sexually abused more than 30 minor girls between 1999 and 2007.
Epstein's 2008 non-prosecution agreement (NPA) is characterized as a "shockingly minimal charge" that allowed his enterprise to continue.
The plaintiff alleges she was 16 years old when Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell sexually assaulted and falsely imprisoned her at Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico.
A second assault allegedly occurred at billionaire Les Wexner's Ohio estate, where Wexner's security personnel prevented the plaintiff from leaving even after she pleaded with them.
Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly called the plaintiff and threatened to burn all her art and destroy her career to keep her quiet about the assaults.

The plaintiff reported the assaults to the NYPD and FBI, but authorities allegedly ignored her reports, leading her to also contact Vanity Fair magazine, which was allegedly intimidated by Epstein into not publishing her story.
The civil complaint was filed on November 12, 2019, citing the termination of a related criminal action against Epstein on August 29, 2019, as making the claims timely under New York law.
